data.title: Pirate Words and Phrases
data.meta_description: Ahoy, matey! Brush up on your Pirate Lingo with our fun and informative page. Learn the jargon and talk like a true pirate on our cruises in Lewes, DE.
data.text: Aye, Aye A crew member says this to the Captain, meaning “I will get that done right away!” Cleave Him to the Brisket An order to kill a man by cutting across his chest from the shoulders to stomach. Davy Jones’ Locker A mystical fable about an evil spirit from the bottom of the ocean that draws pirates or sailors down to their death Keelhaul Painful punishment whereby the pirates drag a person side-to-side under the pirate ship and they get cut up by the planks and barnacles from the bottom of the ship Maroon Leave someone stranded on a deserted island with no supplies, which was a common punishment for any crew members who disrespected or dishonored the Captain No Prey, No Pay The ship’s crew received no wages; however they got a part of the loot or treasure Poop deck (Not the toilet!) This is a part of the ship above the Captain’s headquarters at the farthest point back Savvy? A question asking, “Do you get it?” or “Do you understand?” Scallywag A kidding type of word that a superior pirate might call one of the rookie pirates Son of a Biscuit Eater A name or insult for someone you dislike Splice the Mainbrace! Pass a round of drinks out to the crew Walk the Plank Prisoner is ordered to walk off the board overlapping the ocean, which results in drowning and presumably a meet-up with Davy Jones Locker. Weigh Anchor and Hoist the Mizzen! An order to the crew to pull up the anchor and get this ship sailing!
